heading: hello, kitty
subheading: a housecat has given birth to a rare african wildcat in a surrogate birth experiment. researchers at the audubon institute for research of endangered species in new orleans hope common tabbies could help to save species of endangered wildcats. the embryo came from the institute's "frozen zoo," where the eggs of rare specimens are stored to prevent their extinction. wildcats, which look very much like their domestic cousins, are the smallest of the exotic cats.
author: wired staff
text: a housecat has given birth to a rare african wildcat in a surrogate birth experiment. researchers at the audubon institute for research of endangered species in new orleans hope common tabbies could help to save species of endangered wildcats. the embryo came from the institute's "frozen zoo," where the eggs of rare specimens are stored to prevent their extinction. wildcats, which look very much like their domestic cousins, are the smallest of the exotic cats.
